definition: scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
authority/power/right/(literary) to weigh/expedient/temporary
surname Quan
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose
sharp/favorable/advantage/benefit/profit/interest/to do good to/to benefit
surname Li

sentences.english: They don't scramble against careerists for interest and power.
sentences.chinese: 野心家在那兒爭權奪利，他們不會隨之起舞。

sentences.english: However, when different factions jockey fiercely for power, the support of the military is crucial.
sentences.chinese: 但不同黨羽爭權奪利時，有軍隊做後盾就很關鍵。

sentences.english: Quite unaccountably, the Chinese fought among themselves for power and money, suspecting and hating each other.
sentences.chinese: 中國人就是那樣毫無原因地互相爭權奪利和猜疑仇恨。

sentences.english: Or because the struggle for power between the two brothers?
sentences.chinese: 或是因爲兩兄弟間的爭權奪利？

definition: to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
fight to the death/desperate struggle
traitor
feudalism
scoundrel/rogue/bully/villain
political enemy/opponent
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
political relations
lit. to order people by pointing the chin (idiom); to signal orders by facial gesture/arrogant and bossy
law and order/rules and discipline
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
